div.p: SANCTIFICATION, the act of ſanctifying, or rendering a thing holy. The reformed divines define ſanctification to be an act of God’s grace, by which a perſon’s deſires and affections are alienated ſrom the world; and by which he is made to die to ſin, and to live to righteouſneſs; or, in other words, to feel an abhorrence of all vice, and a love of religion and virtue.
